instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Green to Orange but no Boot on Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: i initially was getting green to orange with no boot; replaced fuse f7140 (there were two small solder balls around it) and fan began to spin; i got the computer to boot once or twice but then nothing; the fan still spins; i disconnected everything and plugged it back in one at a time; the cable for the wifi that runs through the spine seemed to stop it from working;  and <CHIP>U7190</CHIP> im still getting 7 volts off of pin 3 so must be something else; when i replaced the fuse ; im a bit losed

threads.title: Green to Orange but no Boot on Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: wich board is this? Voltage on F7140? Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 from <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>?

threads.title: Green to Orange but no Boot on Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: this is a air board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> im getting only 17volts on pin 1 of j7000. seems low since schematic is calling for 18.5 volts. f7140 is at 8.58volts; on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> i bleieve 3.5 ohms between 17 and 18 and 20.9 ohms between 27 and 28; thank you for replying. I am new to this; Im not sure if i measured the resistance between the two pads correclty. Please refresh me on how to do so if time permits. Thanks again.
